_header: Why will the merchants of renown
Subjects: abuses of the age; merchants, against
_description:
William Dunbar, ‘To the merchantis of Edinburgh’ — eleven stanzas (aaab) and ‘a kind of bob-and-wheel consisting of a dimeter line and two tetrameter lines riming bab, lines five and seven serving as a double refrain throughout the poem’ (Ridley (1973)
XRidley, Florence H. “Middle Scots Writers.” A Manual of the Writings in Middle English Albert E. Hartung Vol. 4, Fascicle 10. Hamden, CT: Archon Books, 1973, 1026-7)
